message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We used a combination of household survey data from the Ethiopia Socioeconomic Survey (ESS) and satellite-based nightlight data to investigate the relationship between electricity access and economic outcomes in rural Ethiopia.", "dataset": ["Ethiopia Socioeconomic Survey (ESS)", "satellite-based nightlight data"], "topic": ["Energy", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "In addition, we combined primary census data with secondary datasets on poverty rates and land use to examine the drivers of land degradation in rural Tanzania.", "dataset": ["primary census data", "secondary datasets on poverty rates", "land use"], "topic": ["Environment", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "Using administrative data on government contracts and a natural experiment variation in political allocation of public funds, we estimate the impact of ethnic partitioning on contract enforcement and quality of service delivery in Nigeria.", "dataset": ["administrative data on government contracts"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "To evaluate the impact of credit on agricultural productivity, we exploit two waves of panel data from the Uganda National Household Survey (UNHS) complemented by credit registry data.", "dataset": ["Uganda National Household Survey (UNHS)", "credit registry data"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze survey data from smallholder farmers in Kenya and combine it with remote sensing data to examine the impact of weather shocks and insurance on agricultural production and income.", "dataset": ["survey data from smallholder farmers in Kenya", "remote sensing data"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food", "Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses a combination of globally available meteorological data and country-specific input factors to estimate the crop suitability for sugarcane in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["globally available meteorological data"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using the Global Financial Inclusion data set (Global Findex), this paper examines the relationship between financial inclusion, gender equality, and poverty in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["Global Financial Inclusion data set (Global Findex)"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Gender", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "In this evaluation, we use administrative data on the Mexican social security system supplemented by a variety of household survey datasets to estimate the causal impact of retirement incentives on elderly welfare.", "dataset": ["administrative data on the Mexican social security system", "variety of household survey datasets"], "topic": ["Social Protection"]}, {"sentence": "This article uses a unique national dataset of commercial insurance claims in Zimbabwe and South Africa to examine patterns of mobile phone insurance adoption among smallholder farmers.", "dataset": ["national dataset of commercial insurance claims in Zimbabwe and South Africa"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "Drawing on primary survey data from the Kenya Life Panel Survey (KLPS) and complementary administrative data on school finance, this study analyzes the determinants of intergenerational transmission of education among young people in rural Kenya.", "dataset": ["Kenya Life Panel Survey (KLPS)", "administrative data on school finance"], "topic": ["Education"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "We used a combination of household survey data from the Ethiopia Socioeconomic Survey (ESS) and satellite-based nightlight data to investigate the relationship between electricity access and economic outcomes in rural Ethiopia.", "dataset": ["Ethiopia Socioeconomic Survey (ESS)", "satellite-based nightlight data"], "topic": ["Energy", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "In addition, we combined primary census data with secondary datasets on poverty rates and land use to examine the drivers of land degradation in rural Tanzania.", "dataset": ["primary census data", "secondary datasets on poverty rates", "land use"], "topic": ["Environment", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "Using administrative data on government contracts and a natural experiment variation in political allocation of public funds, we estimate the impact of ethnic partitioning on contract enforcement and quality of service delivery in Nigeria.", "dataset": ["administrative data on government contracts"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "To evaluate the impact of credit on agricultural productivity, we exploit two waves of panel data from the Uganda National Household Survey (UNHS) complemented by credit registry data.", "dataset": ["Uganda National Household Survey (UNHS)", "credit registry data"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze survey data from smallholder farmers in Kenya and combine it with remote sensing data to examine the impact of weather shocks and insurance on agricultural production and income.", "dataset": ["survey data from smallholder farmers in Kenya", "remote sensing data"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food", "Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses a combination of globally available meteorological data and country-specific input factors to estimate the crop suitability for sugarcane in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["globally available meteorological data"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using the Global Financial Inclusion data set (Global Findex), this paper examines the relationship between financial inclusion, gender equality, and poverty in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["Global Financial Inclusion data set (Global Findex)"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Gender", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "In this evaluation, we use administrative data on the Mexican social security system supplemented by a variety of household survey datasets to estimate the causal impact of retirement incentives on elderly welfare.", "dataset": ["administrative data on the Mexican social security system", "variety of household survey datasets"], "topic": ["Social Protection"]}, {"sentence": "This article uses a unique national dataset of commercial insurance claims in Zimbabwe and South Africa to examine patterns of mobile phone insurance adoption among smallholder farmers.", "dataset": ["national dataset of commercial insurance claims in Zimbabwe and South Africa"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "Drawing on primary survey data from the Kenya Life Panel Survey (KLPS) and complementary administrative data on school finance, this study analyzes the determinants of intergenerational transmission of education among young people in rural Kenya.", "dataset": ["Kenya Life Panel Survey (KLPS)", "administrative data on school finance"], "topic": ["Education"]}]
